title: What pond fish eat tadpoles? - Quora

response.answer_text: From Google search: To kill the frogs you have to kill the babies. Introduce fish that eat tadpoles. Koi, Goldish or a whole lot of betta fish. Bettas are hardy and can survive almost anywhere. More here: "Natural" way to kill frogs in Ponds?

Predators that eat tadpoles include many species, or types, of fish such as bass, trout and sunfish and many birds such as herons, egrets and kingfishers. The larvae, or immature young, of many water insects, eat tadpoles as well.
